private_information: I arrive at Marina District at 9:00AM
I want to meet as many friends as possible during the day
I can travel between Marina District and Embarcadero using the given travel times
traveler.goal: Meet as many friends as possible today while respecting travel times and individual availabilities

private_information: I will be at Embarcadero from 1:30PM to 8:45PM
I can meet for a minimum of 60 minutes during that availability window
barbara.goal: Meet the traveler for at least 60 minutes while at Embarcadero

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent schedules and produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that schedules meetings respecting travel times and availabilities, ensuring Barbara is met for at least 60 minutes and maximizing the number of friends met

public_information: You arrive at Marina District at 9:00AM
Travel time from Marina District to Embarcadero is 14 minutes
Travel time from Embarcadero to Marina District is 12 minutes
Barbara will be at Embarcadero from 1:30PM to 8:45PM
You would like to meet Barbara for a minimum of 60 minutes
The overall objective is to meet as many friends as possible during the day

provide_schedule.system_prompt: You are the traveler planning a day in San Francisco. Provide your available time windows, constraints, and preferences for meeting friends. Do not emit PDDL. Describe earliest departure time, travel constraints, and meeting duration preferences.
provide_schedule.prompt: Your name is traveler. You arrive at the Marina District at 9:00AM. Use the public information about travel times between Marina District and Embarcadero. You want to meet as many friends as possible today. Provide a clear summary of your available time windows, feasible travel times you can accept, any breaks or constraints, and minimum meeting durations. Output a structured schedule summary that the orchestrator can consume.

provide_schedule.system_prompt: You are Barbara. Provide your availability and any constraints for meeting during the day. Do not emit PDDL. Describe the exact time window you will be at Embarcadero and any flexibility or preferences for meeting durations.
provide_schedule.prompt: Your name is barbara. You will be at Embarcadero from 1:30PM to 8:45PM and can meet for at least 60 minutes within that window. Provide a clear availability summary, preferred meeting start times if any, and any constraints the orchestrator should consider.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL planning and target the FastDownwards solver. Integrate schedules and constraints from agents to produce a complete PDDL domain and problem that FastDownwards can consume. Keep different agents' actions distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Receive the traveler schedule and Barbara availability. Consider public information: arrival at Marina at 9:00AM, travel times Marina->Embarcadero 14 minutes and Embarcadero->Marina 12 minutes. Barbara is available at Embarcadero from 1:30PM to 8:45PM and a meeting with Barbara must last at least 60 minutes. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes locations, travel durations, agent actions for moving and meeting, time windows, and an optimization objective to maximize the number of friends met while respecting Barbara's meeting constraint. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
